intro: Calcearia montis-stellaris, commonly known as the star mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Pyrenees. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Its leaves are typically succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, helping to conserve moisture. Calcearia montis-stellaris is a rare and specialized species, often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 2,000 meters.
